Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bozzybear
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights over new years and can recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. Free coffee all day and night and WIFI in your room make for a great stay. The staff are friendly and professional, the hotel is located in an ideal position and despite being next to the airport is also very quiet. There is also a great complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “They have everything you need. Its like a Wal-Mart.”
Reviews.Author: Faridk15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing i stayed here they have shuttle serice to the airport and strip for free and airport pickup. Amazing location 10 min drive to the strip. And room service is amazing. The lobby is a good place to sit. And the free breakfast is amazing. Hampton inn never lets me down.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: barbsab88
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean. The water was always hot. The breakfast was always wonderful and it changed from day to day. The front desk was very kind and the shuttle drivers even kinder. I appreciated all of their help and it was much more than I had expected. The shuttle drivers give you all sorts of advice about the area and love getting to know you. We had the pleasure of meeting 4 different drivers all of whom a pleasurable experience. They will only take you to Mandalay Bay (but it's free - how cool!) and you have to walk further down the strip, so we got a bus pass for the strip which was very affordable and convenient. The reviews about noise confuse me. No one in my room had a problem with this. We watched planes go back and forth all day in awe of how cool it was, but never heard them. There is a little pub within walking distance if you are looking for easy lunch or dinner that they recommend. We ate there often but did not have a good experience there after midnight though. The late night staff was a whole different experience (chef and waiter both terrible).

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you don't want to stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sng49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, March 2012. It's clean, quiet (despite the airport) with a very good breakfast buffet. If you're not looking for the excitement of being on the Strip, it's a good choice. The staff that we dealt with were friendly and helpful. This was our second stay here, the first being spring 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff eased the pain”
Reviews.Author: UntamedAZlady
Reviews.Content: Mine was an unplanned stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites. My flight had been canceled due to weather in Chicago and the alternate flight I was booked on had been oversold. For me this meant an extra two unscheduled nights in Las Vegas. The hotel provides 24 hour shuttle service to the airport and the driver did an excellent job of accomodating my need to go back to the airport several times over two days. The front desk staff was very kind in making sure I had everything I needed and even made recommendations for nearby places the shuttle could drop me for shopping. The breakfast staff and housekeeping were all very attentive and the room clean and comfortable. I can definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay if you want to be near the airport off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not truthful”
Reviews.Author: ballhawg
Reviews.Content: We flew in and out of Vegas with a two week trip to Southern Utah in between. We decide to stay at the South Eastern Ave Hampton because it was close to the airport and advertised shuttle service which would make it easy to return the rental car and then get some sleep. We waited 35 minutes at the rental car pick-up station (with three phone calls to the Hampton, all assuring us the shuttle would be there in less than ten minutes)---we finally took a $20 cab ride to the motel. The next morning the shuttle could only take us to the airport at either 5:00 or 6:00 so we again caught a $20 cab----please factor this cost into your stay if you plan to use the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went up and beyond with a smile”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel when I visit Las Vegas. I have stayed at other Hampton and Hilton Properties, I have stayed at Staybridge Suites and Holiday Inn, and also strip casino hotels. I prefer this location because of the friendly staff and the great service. Michael checked me in and he acknowledged my preferences and welcomed me back to the property. He answered my questions with a smile and provided great service by telling me about the breakfast. While bringing my items in, I noticed that a lady was pretty upset about something small in her room. I think she didn't get enough pillows (even though there are already 4 to a king and 3 to a queen). Michael handled her complaint in a professional manner and resolved the issue, as far as I could tell. Even though this lady was probably a little crazy, he was great and did what he needed to do to take care of the guest. Theresa was super friendly and remembered me from previous visits. She got me extra soaps and shampoos for my extended stay. She was working on a paperwork item when I asked and she stopped what she was doing to help me. I was pleased that my business was important. The breakfast staff was very friendly and checked with me to see if I was doing okay and if I had everything I needed. They did more then just setup the food and make sure the area was clean. They delivered personalized service by asking how the meal was and taking the dirty plates. Rebecca also remembered me from previous visits and talked to me in the Breakfast area. She was interested in what I had planned for my trip and was excited that I came back to visit. She offered some recommendations for a couple places to visit and check out. She followed up with me halfway through my stay to make sure things were going well. I appreciate the amazing staff this location has. Quiet hotel vs other hotels on the vegas strip. Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but you can hear the planes taking off...”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: I arrived Friday evening around 11 pm for a one night stay. The desk clerk was pleasant and check in was painless. I asked about printing my boarding pass for the next day. The clerk pointed me to the Business Center in a room behind the check in area. The Center contains two PCs and two printers. The "wall" to the outside is glass floor to ceiling. You need your room key to get in, so no one without a key can get in. The room was nice sized with a king sized bed. Sitting on top of the bed was a "laptop desk"... a piece of wood padded on the bottom with hand holds (like a dinner tray) so you can sit in bed and use your laptop easily. The TV remote was also on the tray. I found the bed to be quite comfortable. The room also had a desk with a desk chair, but it wasn't conveniently set up to work at the desk and watch TV at the same time. The bathroom had a very large shower (the size of a bathtub) with sliding glass doors to the floor instead of a tub. I liked this idea. I don't know if this is standard throughout the hotel. Note: This was not a "handicap accessible" room. I had read about the runway noise (takeoffs only) and so I put the a/c fan "on" overnight. Someone in another review mentioned the air conditioner as a noise contributor. Since you can set the fan to "on" and it's a constant drone, I consider the a/c fan as "white noise" and was hoping that it would drown out any airplane noise. I was planning to get up around 6:30 am, but was awoken just after 6 am when a plane took off. So, my idea didn't work. But, I sleep pretty light that early in the morning, so I don't know if you would be bothered or not. Breakfast was from 6 - 10 am. The breakfast area was different than what I was expecting. The serving area was standard, but the seating was different. There were a few standard tables, but then there were several tables that were more "coffee table" height than dining table height. In addition in the middle there was a long "bar" with bar type seating on each side (you were facing a person across from you). The breakfast was pretty standard. The "hot" items (that I saw) were scrambled eggs, sausage patties, and waffles (you make yourself). The scrambled eggs were ok, but the eggs were in the smallest pieces. I almost needed a spoon to eat them. I'm sure this has more to do with who made that batch of eggs than anything else. The apple juice was "watered down", but since it's a machine mixing concentrate and water, I think the replacement concentrate wasn't hooked up quite right. The orange juice tasted fine (same machine with concentrate and water). Checkout was quick and painless. Except for the noise of jets taking off starting at 6 am each morning, I'd recommend the hotel without exception. If you're sensitive to noise while sleeping or just before waking up, then you might want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy even with earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Prickly
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to where we needed to be for our three days in Las Vegas. It was also reasonably priced. The room was large, clean and comfortable. HOWEVER, being close to the airport runway made for lots of noise from about 6 AM to 10 PM. Another noise contributor was the air conditioner. Earplugs helped, but not entirely, and who wants to wear them!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good breakfast, good value”
Reviews.Author: mobva
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised at the size of my room at the Hampton Inn Las Vegas airport. It is on the south east corner of McCarran, literally across the street from the runway. I heard some planes taking off occasionally, but it was really not loud enough to be a distraction. If you are super sensitive to noise, that might be a problem, but it never woke me up. The breakfast was very good and they mixed it up so you did not have to eat the same thing everyday. There were scrambled eggs one day, omelets another. Everyday waffles, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, etc. were available. My room had a microwave and fridge, I assume they all do. The room itself was one large space with a sitting area and bed. The desk split the two areas and was comfortable to work at for hours. I had a car, so I don’t know how much cab fare is to the strip. Depending on where you are going, it is at least 10 minutes or more to the strip, so I would guess cabs will run $10 or so. Cars are cheap in Vegas and parking is free everywhere, so I usually get a car. That gives you the flexibility to head out of town to Hoover Dam and hit some great local restaurants. Breakfast is included, but there is a decent breakfast focused restaurant across the street called Egg Works if you want something different. The Hampton Inn is a great Value, it will be on my short list for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: jancarol123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on January 17, 2011. I am a frequent business traveler Pros - clean rooms, nice lobby, convenient location Cons - very loud - my room was close to the elevator and the constant dinging was maddening; the air conditioner sounded like a plane taking off when it came on and then there were the real planes taking off late into the night and starting up in the wee hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A really bad experience”
Reviews.Author: jimsnydrt1
Reviews.Content: Shuttle driver still has not showed up after 5 calls to hotel took a taxi Room right on airport runway. Got more sleep on airplane.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a casino”
Reviews.Author: VolkerS2
Reviews.Content: Even though you can get a much better rate in Las Vegas casinos from Sunday to Thursday nights, this s a much better place to stay. Conveniently located near the airport and its rental car return facility I never was disturbed in my room by the noise of starting or landing aircraft. The windows are very well insulated - and they keep the warmth inn, so that I did not need the heater. The bed: just marvelous, finally a real duvet. The breakfast typical Hampton Inn style, better than average. Check-In and Check-Out fast and courteous. I can recommend this hotel for all of those who don't mind a few miles to the next slot machine.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful while in Las Vegas using your credit card but be more careful at this hotel doing so”
Reviews.Author: Tonysarali
Reviews.Content: I came to las Vegas for a wedding on January 27th 2011 and only used my debit card at this hotel for checking in after booking the rooms on the Internet. I flee back to Houston that Sunday evening and whenI woke up the next money. $500 has already left my account. Someone has being shopping around in Las Vegas. I called the hotel and they were very defensive to my surprise and did nothing to help. I even complained to their corporate office but nothing was done about it. The good thing was that my bank Chase refunded the funds. Just be careful using your card for transactions in Las Vegas but especially at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Spent one night with spouse on a visit to LAS that didn't involve any gambling, etc. Checkin was fast, easy and friendly. Upgraded to King Suite which was very spacious with sofa and coffee table and a wet bar as you walked in the door. Very clean and a super-comfy bed. Only drawback in room was shower/bathroom was a little dark. Otherwise plenty of light for reading in bed. Outdoor pool. Small business center with printer. Didn't have breakfast as we left hotel at 5:10am. Night before we requested 2 breakfast bags and were told they're ready at 5:00am. Today we were told at 5:05am they aren't ready til 5:30, but front desk clerk said, "I found you two from yesterday." It was fine because the bags are a bottle of water, an apple, a packages muffin and a Special K Cereal bar. Complaint is the evening and morning staff should have the same information for guests. Some people might Not like the aircraft noise, but for us it was nice white noise and fun to watch the planes land.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Jani j
Reviews.Content: Clean, up to date with a superior staff. Made to feel welcome the minute you walk through the door!

Reviews.Title: “New and outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: David3205
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is new and the perfect place to stay if you are going to the airport the next day. It is located one street away from the McCarran Airport. The service is excellent, and the rooms are outstanding! Everything is so simple and clean there. The breakfast was good with plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “decent price”
Reviews.Author: sean m
Reviews.Content: decent little place, off the strip but very accessible to shopping, dining etc. the room was clean and the lady at the desk was very helpful. During the night it was noisy outside or a few rooms over but overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Teasnob
Reviews.Content: It's great to be off the strip. The hotel is located in easy distance of shopping and dining options without the silly casino prices. We stayed twice. The beds were good, rooms very clean, great water pressure in shower and bathroom fans. (Since when did a bathroom fan become a luxury?) Please note, the airport is very close and with flights landing what seems to be every three minutes it is noticeable. The air conditioner in the second room was so loud we could not use it. Ask for a top floor room or you will hear footsteps all night long. It's a good value for the dollar in a city of ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bedding”
Reviews.Author: RedKos
Reviews.Content: I am a HIlton Honors member and have stayed at many Hampton & Hilton properties. After I arrived at the Las Vegas Airport Hampton and pulled back the bedsheets, I found numerous long black hairs on the sheets. I'm not a complainer, so I waited until the morning to report this situation to the desk clerk in writing. Several weeks later I rec'd an e-mail asking how my stay was. Once again I reported the dirty bedding. Hampton is supposed to have a 100% satisfaction guarantee, and to date I have yet to get a reply of any sort from either the note I left with the desk clerk or the 15 min. long Hampton survey that I filled out online. It will be the last time I stay at this location and I will not suggest it to anyone I know. After staying at hundreds of Hampton Inn's, I am very disappointed with the non-response from Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, loud airplane noise”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short business trip to LV. It was everything you'd expect from a Hampton Inn - clean, nice room, comfortable bed, very friendly staff. That being said I do have a few complaints: - the airport noise is very loud, I was in the middle of the hotel with a room facing the back and I could hear every plane taking off. I can't imagine how much worse it would have been if I was closer to the runway side. - the in-room AC is pretty loud as well - the complementary wifi was so slow I couldn't used it and instead used my air card. Breakfast was decent, though the eggs were completely overcooked. They have nice touches such as free coffee available, to-go breakfasts, and warm cookies in the evening. If you can tolerate the noise, it's a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at this Hampton”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: This is the third time since I have stayed at this Hampton. The staff was great as always and the location was clean. The Front Desk team was very accommodating during my stay for my needs and let me have a couple extra 'breakfast to go bags' for my long day ahead of me. It was nice to be close enough to the Las Vegas Strip without being on the Strip itself. An easy in and easy out location for most of where I needed to go in the Las Vegas Area. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for one-night-sleep-over”
Reviews.Author: FromHareskovby
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room. The service was good. The noise from the airport was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: edcin912
Reviews.Content: Stood one night....and I have to say the Hampton Inn chain never disappoints. Have used this chain approx. 20x at various locations and they always seem to meet standards. Excellent hotel.......oh the breakfast is always a good touch....better than some provided at other chains. GOOD BUY!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: We drove to Vegas from Grand Canyon on a Saturday evening to catch a flight to LA but ended up missing the flight. So we decided to spend the night in Vegas before taking a 7am flight out. Of course, it was virtually impossible to find a hotel on the Strip being a Saturday and since we had to take a very early flight out we decided to stay close to the airport. Hampton happened to have a room available and the check-in staff was very cheerful (we checked in at midnight so that was nice to see). The room was comfortable (dated, though) and the bathroom was basic but both were very clean. We were there only for a few hours so nothing really mattered. It was clean, the bed was comfortable, the AC was working fine and that was enough. We had one big problem though - we were exhausted so we knew we might not wake up on our own so we asked the front desk to wake us up. I wasn't confident they realized the urgency so I went up to the front desk again and requested them in person to not forget. Now this wasn't an extraordinary request - they said they had a wake-up call system. We were to get out at 5am to catch the flight. I woke up with a start at 6 to realize that there was no wake-up call made to us. We ran out and bumped into the front-desk person I had spoken to and he merely shrugged! That cost us $400 in pre-booked tickets and another $400 to rebook on another flight. What was really frustrating was the callous attitude of the front desk - just a shrug! Really spoilt it for us, apart from making our transit to LA extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service - Clean Rooms - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property. I have stayed at other hotels in Las Vegas this year and this is my favorite off-strip hotel so far. The building looks new and the staff is just amazing. The entire front desk team went out of their way to make sure that my stay was comfortable. At one point, I needed more towels, shampoo, and soap since I didn't want cleaning service and kept my do not disturb sign up. The staff got everything I needed with in 10 minutes. I stayed 6 nights and got to see and interact with almost the entire staff. My only constructive criticism would be to have members of management visible but since I wasn't at the hotel much, they could have been out and about later in the morning. I plan to stay at this hotel again, hopefully this year, when my personal travel brings me back to the Las Vegas Area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smoketrails
Reviews.Content: As aircraftenthusiasts we really enjoyed our stay here! We had asked for a room overlooking the airport. Not being content with the room we were given at first, our replacement suite(with 1 kingsize bed) was brilliant, overlooking the runway and part of the airport. I was a bit worried I wouldn't sleep very well on the sofabed but it was surprisingly comfy. The free breakfast was up to Hampton standards. The newish hotel is clean, comfortable and modern. A nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous & Clean”
Reviews.Author: tshook80
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, everything went smooth. The front desk person was very cheerful (10:30 pm) and made me feel welcome. The room was immaculate and the bed was one of the best I ever slept in. Breakfast had multiple choices and the coffee was tasty. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: rlamond
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in several Hampton properties in Vegas but first time at this one. Clean and fresh, friendly staff and convenient to the strip and Henderson. Only drawback is McCarran runways are within spitting distance. When LAS is departing on the 25's you WILL hear the engines on takeoff. I travel with earplugs so that mitigated most of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with a high end look...but bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: norcalnick
Reviews.Content: This is a newer Hampton Inn and is quite chic for a limited service hotel, it's also a far, far cry from your Fairfield Inn's or Holiday Inn Express type of hotels. The rooms are pretty awesome! The little foyer area as you enter the room is tiled and connects you to the amazingly large bathroom with stand in shower and large granite top vanity. The closet located just outside of the bathroom is a little small, it can hang maybe about 6-8 items perfectly. The bedroom area was great and well decorated. IMO, I think the interior designer of this hotel must really like DWR, Z Gallerie and those type of furnishings. Each morning, they host a complimentary breakfast, which is really an upgraded continental. I wasn't a fan of it but, no complaints really since it's complimentary. They had your basic breads, bagels, muffins, danishes, cereals, fruit, make your waffle, eggs and one meat, coffee, juice, milk and tea. The bread products were cold and when the hostess would replenish them, they literally were just out of the freezer. The coffee wasn't the greatest but had caffeine which is all that mattered to me. One day they had a ham and scrambled egg mixture going on, which was tasty but the next day, it was dried scrambled eggs and paper thin bacon on the side. Again, it's complimentary, it's not designed to satisfy your morning appetite, much less your palate, but, it'll get you through the morning. We ended up only eating there the first 2-mornings out of the 5-mornings we were there. Okay so it's going from excellent to good to bad, it eventually had to happen. The hotel is literally next to the runway of LAS. You can see the runway, from our room at least. You don't hear the planes landing as much as you hear and feel the thunder of the planes taking off. The first night, I literally woke up to the rumble of a plane taking off at 12:40am, probably because our window was vibrating. No kidding! We asked the front desk agent the next morning, who BTW wasn't all that pleasant, but seemed like she had a scripted answer to the ever popular question. We were unpacked anyway and didn't want to move so we just went to CVS and bought ear plugs, which DID help. However, we were in an odd number room, facing the back. I have a feeling if you got an even number room, facing the front, the noise isn't as significant. Not sure why the front desk agent wasn't so proactive in trying to make us happy, the hotel wasn't full or anything the whole time we were there. Overall, it's a nicely furnished hotel. The service might be a little iffy. But it's just too close to the runway for me to comfortably stay there again. But, the concept and design of this newer hotel sure made me appreciate Hampton Inn's much more!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hampton Inn's I have been in!”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I have been a Diamond member for 9 years and rarely stay in a Hampton Inn but this one caught me by surprise. From the moment I walked in, they were VERY warm and welcoming. Even coming and going, they address you by name. I received an upgrade due to my status and was really impressed with the studio suite. Very spacious and clean. The location is right on the end of the start of the runway. You will get some jet blast depending on your room location but really did not bother me. If you are looking for an airport hotel, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - with a glitch”
Reviews.Author: PalmTree49
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable. We stayed overnight so that we could fly out of the Las Vegas Airport on a 7:15 a.m. flight. The hotel shuttle runs on the hour in the mornings, and we were advised to take the 5 a.m. shuttle to the airport. I got up at 3 a.m. and was surprised to find only hot water coming from the shower. I called the desk, and they were helpful. They let me into the unoccupied room across the hall. The hotel has a satisfaction guarantee, so I was not charged for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on the front desk...”
Reviews.Author: endigo99
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and room (breakfast too). However, front desk associate Ashliegh was not helpful. When flight landed I called for pick up. I was told it would be 15 minutes. It was cold and VERY windy so after I had waited :15 minutes I called to check status. She put me on hold and everything... told me they were just about to leave and it would be another :15 minutes. So I waited. I called after waiting :30 and put on hold yet again. Told they were almost there. . . Well, I waited an hour for a pick-up. When the driver came he said Ashliegh never called him and told him I was waiting for a pick-up. When we got to the hotel the driver went directly to her and complained. I had an ear ache from all the wind waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: KailaniRose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend on a "girls trip to Vegas." The room was very clean and the service of the staff was great. Everyone we met were friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was the best part of this hotel. It helps to be able to have a decent breakfast without the noise and smoke of a casino. The hotel is a bit off the strip and you will hear airplane traffic as it is located right next to the airport. Just be sure to ask for a room away from the elevators because you will hear a lot of noise when people use it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, some areas could be better”
Reviews.Author: coldshowerlady
Reviews.Content: On the whole the Inn was new and clean,the shuttle drivers were wonderful and Helen at the front desk was terrific !! Cheers to this part. Jeers to this part; BUT the water was always lukewarm in the shower. Our toilet overflowed and the person wanted to know WHAT we put down it ????, (excuse me just the usual, what a question) Our dead bolt had to be full body pushed/force on to engage. The printer on the computer was out of ink and the other front desk person told me that the allotted ink has been used and didnt have anymore til manager approved it, wow, ok then. The heater thermostat heats the room over the temp and then the AIR conditioner blows FULL blast til it gets to desired temp..its the craziest thing i have ever seen extra blkt needed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Flip_switch
Reviews.Content: The staff at this place were wonderful! Polite and speedy with check-in/check-out. The location of this place is a bit far off. We got stranded in Vegas after a canceled flight and this is where the airline booked us. For a one night stay it was alright. But it is not walking distance/cheap cab ride from the strip. Did read that they do offer a shuttle drop off at Mandalay Bay though. The rooms are very clean. Continental breakfast in the morning is good. Skip the scrambled eggs though. If you just need a night's stay close to the airport, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not an airport hotel if you have a rental car”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: Shame on me, I stayed at this hotel so I would have an easy rental car drop-off before an early flight. It is really, really far from the car rental facility and I would have been better to stay on the Strip. Nice hotel though, and excellent business center for a Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mudd_stuffin
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the better airport hotels I have stayed at and I would compare this with the Wyndham hotel in Henderson. Free breakfast and free internet were nice features. Free shuttle buses to the airport were provided at the top of each hour and to Mandalay Bay at the bottom of each hour. The room was very clean. The only complaint is that I could hear the rumble from the airport but I guess there is not a whole lot that can be done given the proximity.

Reviews.Title: “short but excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sactokw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at Hampton. Arrived in airport late around 11PM on Friday night. They had 24 hour free (tips appreciated) shuttle service to airport or Mandalay Bay. Hotel was fairly new looking, clean and pretty quiet for being close to airport. Check in was fairly quick; service was good; OK'ed for late check out at 12 noon. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was clean with walk in shower and good water pressure. Toilet was low flow but powerful. Room was well designed with work desk and rolling ergo chair; there was a flat screen TV with cable (did not watch much TV during my stay). Free internet connection and free wireless, which is always good to have. Small pool and workout room, which I did not use. Breakfast ended at 10AM. The usual complimentary Hampton breakfast (which is better than most hotels) with scrambled eggs and sausage, cereal, yogurt, juices, pastry, bread, fruits, coffee. Took the Hampton free van to Mandalay Bay (their only drop off place on the strip); driver was nice and informative. Later, call Hampton for pick up at Mandalay Bay; took about 20-30 minutes after call to get picked up; different driver was also very nice; he dropped me off at the airport. Overall, an excellent stay at Hampton. I've stayed at various Hamptons across the country and have come to realize that Hampton is an excellent chain. Tip: If you are expecting a party atmosphere of the strip, this is not your hotel. No large casino close by. It's located next to and south of airport and surrounded by a gas station and a few restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Was dissappointed in one area”
Reviews.Author: misty_rain_917
Reviews.Content: I loved your hotel it was very clean and very nice however we were very tired when we checked in at 11:21 pm which would have been 1:21AM our home time. When I reserved the room through my travel agent he requested that we have a crib for my grandson. When we arrived and checked in I asked if there was a crib in our room the lady said no but she would get me one as soon as her driver of the shuttle come back which would be about 15-20 minutes I told her that would be fine we would give my grandson a bath then he would use the crib. 30 minutes went by and I had looked out the window and seen the shuttle was back I called down to the front desk she again said no the shuttle hadn't been back yet and she would get it soon. 20 minutes later I walked out to my car and seen that the shuttle was there when I was going back into the hotel the shuttle was leaving so I had thought the crib was in the room when I got back to the room still no crib. I counted the shuttlle being back at the hotel 4 diffrernt times and still no crib. 1:30am I called to the front desk and asked I am going to get a crib she said yes mam as soon as the shuttle comes back I told her it had been back 4 times and my grandson is tired and so are we could I please get the crib. My son in law looked out the window and the shuttle was in front of the hotel I called down again she said I am sorry mam but I can't find one by then it was almost 2am I said thank you so much for getting me this crib in 20minutes I was very upset my grandson ended up sleeping on the floor what a nice start to a wonderful vacation. If she didn't have one she could of told me right away.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Suites Las Vegas Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 6575 South Eastern Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89119
